Methods Documentation

classmethod anom(array: xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray, st: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray#

Function to calculate the anomalies on a xarray DataArray

The anomaly is the time variable minus the mean across all times of a given point

Parameters

  • array (xr.DataArray) – Array to process the anomalies. Must have a dimension called time

  • st (bool, default=False) – Indicates whether the anomaly should standarized. Divide by the standard deviation

Raises

  • TypeError –

  • ValueError –

classmethod clim(array: xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray, dim: str = 'time') → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray#

Function that performs the climatology of a xarray Dataset

The climatology is the average across a given axis

Parameters

  • array (xr.DataArray) – Xarray DataArray where you wish to perform the climatology

  • dim (str, default='time') – Dimension where the climatology is going to be performed on

Raises

  • TypeError –

  • ValueError –

classmethod crossvalidation(y: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], z: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], nm: int, alpha: float) → spy4cast.meteo.CrossvalidationOut#
classmethod crossvalidation_mp(y: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], z: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], nm: int, alpha: float) → spy4cast.meteo.CrossvalidationOut#
static index_regression(data: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], index: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], alpha: float) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]]]#

Create correlation (using pearson correlation) and regression :param data: data (space, time) :param index: array of temporal series :param alpha: Significant level :return: Correlation map, map with p values, significative corrrelation map, regression map, significative regression map

classmethod mca(z: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], y: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], nm: int, alpha: float) → spy4cast.meteo.MCAOut#

” Maximum covariance analysis between y (predictor) and Z (predictand)

Parameters

  • z – predictand

  • y – predictor. space x time.

  • nm – number of modes

  • alpha – significant level

Returns

RUY, RUY_sig, SUY, SUY_sig, RUZ, RUZ_sig, SUZ, SUZ_sig, us, Vs, scf

static npanom(array: numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]], axis: int = 0, st: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[Any, numpy.dtype[numpy.float32]]#

Function to calculate the anomalies on a numpy array

The anomaly is the time variable minus the mean across all times of a given point

Parameters

  • array (npt.NDArray[np.float32]) – Array to process the anomalies.

  • axis (int, default=0) – Axis where to perform teh anomaly, ussually the time axis

  • st (bool, default=False) – Indicates whether the anomaly should standarized. Divide by the standard deviation
